definition: to put together various bits/to knock sth together/hash (computing)/see also 散列[san3 lie4]
to gather together, pool or collect/to happen by chance/to move close to/to exploit an opportunity

sentences.english: Unable to get a valid login hash.
sentences.chinese: 无法取得有效的登入杂凑。

sentences.english: A layout of an image to be printed such as a book cover .
sentences.chinese: 杂凑而成的东西将要印刷的图案设计，如书的封面。

sentences.english: This property is the key for the keyed hash algorithm.
sentences.chinese: 这个属性是有金钥的杂凑演算法之金钥。

sentences.english: A portentous soufflé that never truly rises.
sentences.chinese: 一部自命不凡的杂凑，不可能真正成功。

sentences.english: Cryptographic hash functions play a fundamental role in modern cryptography.
sentences.chinese: 在现代密码学中，杂凑函数占据基础而又重要的地位。

definition: lit. a dragon's scale from the east and a dragon's claw from the west/odds and ends (idiom)
neither fish nor fowl/resembling nothing on earth
facing a wall, an imaginary construction (idiom); baseless fabrication
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
variant of 抄襲|抄袭[chao1 xi2]
to apply mechanically/to copy and use
variant of 模擬|模拟[mo2 ni3]
